data.chText: 自愿的；志愿的；主动的；自告奋勇的
data.enText: done willingly, not because you are forced

data.chText: 听这门课纯粹是自愿的。
data.enText: Attendance on the course is purely voluntary.
to pay voluntary contributions into a pension fund

data.chText: 自愿性的；无偿的；义务性的
data.enText: done by people who choose to do it without being paid

data.chText: 我在当地医院从事一些义务性工作。
data.enText: I do some voluntary work at the local hospital.

data.chText: 她自愿在那里无偿工作。
data.enText: She works there on a voluntary basis .

data.chText: 义务性服务 / 团体 / 机构 / 组织
data.enText: voluntary services/bodies/agencies/organizations (= organized, controlled or supported by people who choose to do this and are usually not paid)
the voluntary sector (= organizations which are set up to help people and which do not make a profit, for example charities)

data.chText: 自愿的；志愿的；义务的；自发的
data.enText: doing a job without wanting to be paid for it

data.chText: 仪式终始曲，即兴曲（通常用风琴在教堂礼拜仪式前后或期间演奏）
data.enText: a piece of music played before, during or after a church service, usually on an organ

simple_means.memory_skill: volunt 意志，意愿 + ary …的 → 志愿的，自愿的

means: 仪式终始曲，即兴曲(通常用风琴在教堂礼拜仪式前后或期间演奏)

ex.chText: 另一个收入来源是当地人的自愿捐献。
ex.enText: Another source of income is from voluntary contributions of the local people.

ex.chText: 我们必须坚持自愿参加的原则。
ex.enText: We must adhere to the principle of voluntary participation.

synonyms.bx: 主要用于人或行为，强调主动去做某事，而非应征的、受强迫的，常含无任何报酬之意。

ex.enText: How much is he willing to pay?

ex.chText: 我很愿意把她需要的机会给她。
ex.enText: I was very willing to give her the chance she needed.

ex.chText: 律师告诉我，他非常愿意帮忙。
ex.enText: The lawyer told me he was perfectly willing to help.

synonyms.bx: 强调做某事是自愿而乐意的、心甘情愿的，用于此义时只作表语，通常后接动词不定式。

tr: composition (often improvised) for a solo instrument (especially solo organ) and not a regular part of a religious service or musical performance
(military) a person who freely enlists for service
of your own free will or design
example: voluntary generosity in times of disaster

value.def: Voluntary actions or activities are done because someone chooses to do them and not because they have been forced to do them.

example.ex: Attention is drawn to a special voluntary course in Commercial French...
example.tran: 一门特别的商务法语选修课引起了大家的关注。

example.ex: The scheme, due to begin next month, will be voluntary.
example.tran: 定于下个月开始实施的方案是自愿性质的。

value.tran: 自愿的;志愿的;主动的;自发的

example.ex: I would only leave here voluntarily if there was a big chance to work abroad.
example.tran: 只有当国外有非常好的工作机会时，我才会主动离开这里。

value.def: Voluntary work is done by people who are not paid for it, but who do it because they want to do it.

example.ex: In her spare time she does voluntary work...
He'd  been working at the local hostel for the handicapped on a voluntary basis.
example.tran: 他曾在当地的残疾人救助站当过义工。

value.def: A voluntary worker is someone who does work without being paid for it, because they want to do it.

example.ex: Apna Arts has achieved more with voluntary workers in three years than most organisations with paid workers have achieved in ten...
example.tran: “我们”艺术中心依靠志愿者在3年内取得的成就超过了大多数雇用受薪员工的机构10年中取得的成绩。

example.ex: We depend solely upon our voluntary helpers.
example.tran: 我们完全依靠我们的志愿者。

value.def: A voluntary organization is controlled and organized by the people who have chosen to work for it, often without being paid, rather than receiving help or money from the government.

example.ex: Some local authorities and voluntary organizations also run workshops for disabled people...
example.tran: 一些当地机构和志愿组织也为残疾人开设了一些工场。

example.ex: It has been largely through the voluntary sector that the needs of victims have been met.
example.tran: 受害者的需要主要是通过志愿组织予以满足的。
为出狱囚犯义务提供的宿舍

value.tran: （机构或组织）志愿的，义务性的

rootsaffixes.indicate: = wish, will 意志, 意愿
rootsaffixes.title: vol, volunt

partsOfSpeech.dec: bene 好 + vol 意志，意愿 + ent 具有…性质的，关于…的 → 好意的 → 善心的
male 坏 + vol 意志，意愿 + ent 具有…性质的，关于…的 → 坏意 → 恶意的
vol 意志，意愿 + ition 行为，状态，结果，由行为产生的事物 → 意志力，决心
vol 意志，意愿 + itive …的 → 意志的
volunt 意志，意愿 + ary …的 → 志愿的，自愿的
volunt 意志，意愿 + eer 表人 → 有意愿的人 → 志愿者
